MONL.content: Derrida on his relation to French language; the secret, a tattoo, blood mixed w/ ink, love by setting on fire, graft, mark, let come to itself in itself
MONL.linkedContent: Derrida on his relation to French language; the secret, a tattoo, blood mixed w/ ink, love by setting on fire, graft, mark, let come to itself in itself

MONL.content: prosthesis of origin: prior-to-the-first time of pre-originary language must be invented
MONL.linkedContent: prosthesis of origin: prior-to-the-first time of pre-originary language must be invented

FK.content: in view of invisible, spectral sur-vival, an excess beyond living, life worth more than life, space of death opens—linked to automaton (exemplarily “phallic”), to technics, machine, prosthesis
FK.linkedContent: in view of invisible, spectral sur-vival, an excess beyond living, life worth more than life, space of death opens—linked to automaton (exemplarily “phallic”), to technics, machine, prosthesis

FK.content: growing disproportion btwn knowledge &. know-how (use of artifacts/protheses of which one is totally ignorant)
FK.linkedContent: growing disproportion btwn knowledge &. know-how (use of artifacts/protheses of which one is totally ignorant)

H.content: technological prostheses, whose refinements are unlimited in principle > still give fantasy of auto-nomy, auto-affection: is there hospitality w/out this, w/out auto-affection, the privileged figure of hearing oneself speak?
H.linkedContent: technological prostheses, whose refinements are unlimited in principle > still give fantasy of auto-nomy, auto-affection: is there hospitality w/out this, w/out auto-affection, the privileged figure of hearing oneself speak?

AF.content: the prosthetic, hypomnesic techniques of archive not only place for storing, but also determine structure of the archivable content in its very coming into existence, in its relationship to the future
AF.linkedContent: the prosthetic, hypomnesic techniques of archive not only place for storing, but also determine structure of the archivable content in its very coming into existence, in its relationship to the future

AF.content: Freud’s 2 systems (Ucs & Pcs), 3 points of view (topic, dynamic, economic): that Freud integrates necessity of outside > prosthesis of the inside
AF.linkedContent: Freud’s 2 systems (Ucs & Pcs), 3 points of view (topic, dynamic, economic): that Freud integrates necessity of outside > prosthesis of the inside

AF.content: the proper of the archive, its instant—certain hypomnesic, prosthetic experience of technical substrate [Derrida had this thought while tinkling on his Macintosh computer]
AF.linkedContent: the proper of the archive, its instant—certain hypomnesic, prosthetic experience of technical substrate [Derrida had this thought while tinkling on his Macintosh computer]

SPOM.content: figures of death: differance of technical apparatus, iterability, non-uniqueness, prosthesis, synthetic image, simulacrum, all of which begins in language, before language
SPOM.linkedContent: figures of death: differance of technical apparatus, iterability, non-uniqueness, prosthesis, synthetic image, simulacrum, all of which begins in language, before language

SPOM.content: capital contradiction, at origin of capital: induces the “pragmatic” double constraint of all injunctions [see POO p. 143n difference btwn “use” & “mention”]
SPOM.linkedContent: capital contradiction, at origin of capital: induces the “pragmatic” double constraint of all injunctions [see POO p. 143n difference btwn “use” & “mention”]

SPOM.content: table dances spontaneously, autonomously, but it moves others too
SPOM.linkedContent: table dances spontaneously, autonomously, but it moves others too

SPOM.content: not just contradiction of sensuous non-sensuous in same Thing, but contradiction of automatic autonomy (spontaneity) > on stage of market, table (commodity) is a prosthesis of itself
SPOM.linkedContent: not just contradiction of sensuous non-sensuous in same Thing, but contradiction of automatic autonomy (spontaneity) > on stage of market, table (commodity) is a prosthesis of itself

POOF.content: in history of partisan Schmitt details, there’s a move away from autochthony (1st partisans were nationalists), & a study of tele-technology (new speeds, new relations to space)
POOF.linkedContent: in history of partisan Schmitt details, there’s a move away from autochthony (1st partisans were nationalists), & a study of tele-technology (new speeds, new relations to space)

POOF.content: tele-technical prosthetic automotion breaks w/ autochthony, cuts telluric roots of 1st guerilla wars
POOF.linkedContent: tele-technical prosthetic automotion breaks w/ autochthony, cuts telluric roots of 1st guerilla wars

POOF.content: does Montaigne (via túkhē [see 192n re: Cicero], exceptionality of friendship) add rupture of infinite to Greek philía? a reassuring principle would periodize, overdetermine, oppose Christian fraternity to Greek fraternity > Derrida won’t have it: the discrepancies of culture aren’t negligible but they are that of a generative graft, cultural body (so old & new) begins w/ prosthesis > no proper body w/out graft: endless political consequences of this law—now more than ever, endlessly
POOF.linkedContent: does Montaigne (via túkhē [see 192n re: Cicero], exceptionality of friendship) add rupture of infinite to Greek philía? a reassuring principle would periodize, overdetermine, oppose Christian fraternity to Greek fraternity > Derrida won’t have it: the discrepancies of culture aren’t negligible but they are that of a generative graft, cultural body (so old & new) begins w/ prosthesis > no proper body w/out graft: endless political consequences of this law—now more than ever, endlessly

POOF.content: for Montaigne, the alliance/election of perfect friendship functions like a seam (couture), it solders > solder & seam a vocabulary of artifice, so the question [of POOF]: why does the natural schema [re: friendship] remain [in the figure of one body?]?
POOF.linkedContent: for Montaigne, the alliance/election of perfect friendship functions like a seam (couture), it solders > solder & seam a vocabulary of artifice, so the question [of POOF]: why does the natural schema [re: friendship] remain [in the figure of one body?]?

POOF.content: once again referring to the ‘infinite’ Christianization of Greek fraternity, while reminding us that Greek phília carries w/in it the injunction of its infinitization, Derrida will privilege Christianiziation for the role it played in the theological-political graft that constructed political discourse of modern Europe
POOF.linkedContent: once again referring to the ‘infinite’ Christianization of Greek fraternity, while reminding us that Greek phília carries w/in it the injunction of its infinitization, Derrida will privilege Christianiziation for the role it played in the theological-political graft that constructed political discourse of modern Europe

SEC.content: a written sign can break with its context (set of presences which organize moment of inscription), still be legible, can always be lifted from interlocking chain, grafted into other chains ——no context, no code can enclose it > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)
SEC.linkedContent: a written sign can break with its context (set of presences which organize moment of inscription), still be legible, can always be lifted from interlocking chain, grafted into other chains ——no context, no code can enclose it > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)

SEC.content: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force
SEC.linkedContent: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force

T.content: tympanum punctures itself (se crève), grafts itself > resists concepts of machine or nature, de coupure ou de corps, resists metaphysics of castration
T.linkedContent: tympanum punctures itself (se crève), grafts itself > resists concepts of machine or nature, de coupure ou de corps, resists metaphysics of castration

F.content: question of crypt (singular not general) precedes philosophical questions re: Thing, Thinking > false, “artificial” unconscious (new metaphorical terrain): graft in heart of the organ
F.linkedContent: question of crypt (singular not general) precedes philosophical questions re: Thing, Thinking > false, “artificial” unconscious (new metaphorical terrain): graft in heart of the organ

DS.content: [Mimique] haunted by ghost or grafted onto arborescence of another text
DS.linkedContent: [Mimique] haunted by ghost or grafted onto arborescence of another text

DS.content: graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)
DS.linkedContent: graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)

DS.content: Bachelard: we love the graft, graft gives matter to flower, Art is grafted nature
DS.linkedContent: Bachelard: we love the graft, graft gives matter to flower, Art is grafted nature

DS.content: interminable network of Pierrot’s (mimes), already remarked as grafting inside Mallarmé’s text, which thus no longer has an inside
DS.linkedContent: interminable network of Pierrot’s (mimes), already remarked as grafting inside Mallarmé’s text, which thus no longer has an inside

DS.content: [re: Mallarmé] to write the word insertion (to place w/in, to graft) is to quote the practice of spacing (same goes for writing antre ouvert)
DS.linkedContent: [re: Mallarmé] to write the word insertion (to place w/in, to graft) is to quote the practice of spacing (same goes for writing antre ouvert)

DS.content: certain mimic inscribes a graft in one corner, holding antre open
DS.linkedContent: certain mimic inscribes a graft in one corner, holding antre open

DS.content: [re: Les Mots anglais] French grafted onto English—born of an “indissoluble hymen”
DS.linkedContent: [re: Les Mots anglais] French grafted onto English—born of an “indissoluble hymen”

POS.content: the strategy of paleonomy, of using old name, refers to play of stratagem not hierarchical organization of means & ends: 1) extract predicative trait held in reserve 2) extend, graft, extracted trait, as a lever of intervention, transforming previous organization [writing]
POS.linkedContent: the strategy of paleonomy, of using old name, refers to play of stratagem not hierarchical organization of means & ends: 1) extract predicative trait held in reserve 2) extend, graft, extracted trait, as a lever of intervention, transforming previous organization [writing]

SP.content: remainder: no proper itinerary, no center, could mean nothing, no end to parodying play w/ meaning, grafted beyond any contextual body or finite code
SP.linkedContent: remainder: no proper itinerary, no center, could mean nothing, no end to parodying play w/ meaning, grafted beyond any contextual body or finite code

SP.content: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft
SP.linkedContent: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft

O.content: preface as excrement of philosophical essentiality? that which falls away (la tombée) > can we account for preface differently?
O.linkedContent: preface as excrement of philosophical essentiality? that which falls away (la tombée) > can we account for preface differently?

O.content: dissemination: generalizes theory/practice of graft w/out proper body, skew w/out straight line [?], bias w/out front [Nietzsche perspectivism?]
O.linkedContent: dissemination: generalizes theory/practice of graft w/out proper body, skew w/out straight line [?], bias w/out front [Nietzsche perspectivism?]

REST.content: for Freud, the shoe always a “form” of prosthesis, but always as a penis (woman’s penis too)? but Ferenczi recognizes in it the vagina
REST.linkedContent: for Freud, the shoe always a “form” of prosthesis, but always as a penis (woman’s penis too)? but Ferenczi recognizes in it the vagina

REST.content: fetish generation is syntactical, meaning it never designates a detachable whole: a relatively detachable part of an always divisible ensemble
REST.linkedContent: fetish generation is syntactical, meaning it never designates a detachable whole: a relatively detachable part of an always divisible ensemble

REST.content: Shapiro treats shoes as reproduction of real shoes, misses that, for Heidegger, shoes don’t relate to given subjectum, or given world, he won’t be able to avoid the bridge, doesn’t know shoes’re already prosthetic—précipitée dans l’abîme, la sphinge, dès l’instant où l’enflure (turgidity)
REST.linkedContent: Shapiro treats shoes as reproduction of real shoes, misses that, for Heidegger, shoes don’t relate to given subjectum, or given world, he won’t be able to avoid the bridge, doesn’t know shoes’re already prosthetic—précipitée dans l’abîme, la sphinge, dès l’instant où l’enflure (turgidity)

REST.content: that the shoes can always be someone else’s: “to be in someone’s shoes [in English]”
REST.linkedContent: that the shoes can always be someone else’s: “to be in someone’s shoes [in English]”

D.content: each germ is its own term—finds its term w/in itself as its own internal limit, faisant angle avec sa proper mort [tracing, grafting, semen already swarming (essaimée)]
D.linkedContent: each germ is its own term—finds its term w/in itself as its own internal limit, faisant angle avec sa proper mort [tracing, grafting, semen already swarming (essaimée)]

D.content: all these grafts, this is (est) that, this means that [forever]
D.linkedContent: all these grafts, this is (est) that, this means that [forever]

D.content: to write means to graft (same word), each grafted text radiates toward the site of its removal, s’y régénèrent dans la répétition, à la bordure d’un surjet (overcast seam)
D.linkedContent: to write means to graft (same word), each grafted text radiates toward the site of its removal, s’y régénèrent dans la répétition, à la bordure d’un surjet (overcast seam)

D.content: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]
D.linkedContent: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]

PPT.content: trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints
PPT.linkedContent: trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints

LI.content: “le vert est ou” [Husserl] could be grafted w/ meaning: an example of agrammaticality
LI.linkedContent: “le vert est ou” [Husserl] could be grafted w/ meaning: an example of agrammaticality

LI.content: la hantise of the graft, herein no different from the parasite > never simply alien to and separable from the body it already haunts
LI.linkedContent: la hantise of the graft, herein no different from the parasite > never simply alien to and separable from the body it already haunts

TN.content: death introduces drive of expropriation, but is still more tolerable than prosthesis, metonymic substitute, technical survival [l’intrus] (complicates incarnation even more)
TN.linkedContent: death introduces drive of expropriation, but is still more tolerable than prosthesis, metonymic substitute, technical survival [l’intrus] (complicates incarnation even more)

TN.content: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung

TN.content: being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any "work of mourning”
TN.linkedContent: being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any "work of mourning”

TN.content: aristocracy of one sense, or democracy of all: these battles due to tropological displacements, originary prosthetic possibilities; prosthetics never wait, Nancy’s “technē of bodies”
TN.linkedContent: aristocracy of one sense, or democracy of all: these battles due to tropological displacements, originary prosthetic possibilities; prosthetics never wait, Nancy’s “technē of bodies”

TN.content: singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue
TN.linkedContent: singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue

TN.content: differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)
TN.linkedContent: differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)

TN.content: the selfsame (même) heart exappropriates instant touched by other, no possible reappropriation (absolute mourning)
TN.linkedContent: the selfsame (même) heart exappropriates instant touched by other, no possible reappropriation (absolute mourning)

TN.content: apparently, women respond better to heart grafts [?]
TN.linkedContent: apparently, women respond better to heart grafts [?]

E.content: for Kant, sight is most noble sense, but hearing is least replaceable, most allergic to prosthesis, tolerates substitution badly, almost succeeds in resisting vicariousness: this is why the mute will never know concepts, they cannot access the universal signs
E.linkedContent: for Kant, sight is most noble sense, but hearing is least replaceable, most allergic to prosthesis, tolerates substitution badly, almost succeeds in resisting vicariousness: this is why the mute will never know concepts, they cannot access the universal signs

E.content: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis
E.linkedContent: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis

BSi.content: political sovereignty as the fable of a monstrous animal is prosthetic, prostatic, prosthstatic: supplement that supplements nature by adding an artificial organ, here the state
BSi.linkedContent: political sovereignty as the fable of a monstrous animal is prosthetic, prostatic, prosthstatic: supplement that supplements nature by adding an artificial organ, here the state

BSi.content: for Hobbes, man as artist mimics art of God [cf. E Kant-like?]; Leviathan is artificial, thus sovereignty a human artifact, monster prosthetic made in lab, and not indivisible, absolute, as Hobbes argues (commentary > interpretation: consequences beyond explicit intention)
BSi.linkedContent: for Hobbes, man as artist mimics art of God [cf. E Kant-like?]; Leviathan is artificial, thus sovereignty a human artifact, monster prosthetic made in lab, and not indivisible, absolute, as Hobbes argues (commentary > interpretation: consequences beyond explicit intention)

BSi.content: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity
BSi.linkedContent: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity

BSi.content: state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify
BSi.linkedContent: state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify

BSi.content: animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State
BSi.linkedContent: animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State

BSi.content: prosthstatic sovereignty presupposes right of man over beasts
for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”
BSi.linkedContent: for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”

BSi.content: political contract, a prosthesis, nomos as thesis (opposed to physis), convention, positing
BSi.linkedContent: political contract, a prosthesis, nomos as thesis (opposed to physis), convention, positing

BSi.content: thus provisional, historical, always deconstructible > declared immortal because not
BSi.linkedContent: thus provisional, historical, always deconstructible > declared immortal because not

BSi.content: sovereign state as Leviathan, as animal-machine, as prosthstatics > beast et (est) sovereign coupled across a copula: affinity through analogy, proportion, reciprocal fascination—or grafting
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign state as Leviathan, as animal-machine, as prosthstatics > beast et (est) sovereign coupled across a copula: affinity through analogy, proportion, reciprocal fascination—or grafting

BSi.content: in Kleist’s “On the Marionette Theater,” consciousness that passes through infinity becomes pure unconsciousness, that of a god or mannequin, grace of prosthesis
BSi.linkedContent: in Kleist’s “On the Marionette Theater,” consciousness that passes through infinity becomes pure unconsciousness, that of a god or mannequin, grace of prosthesis

SPEC.content: transference, ersatz, prosthesis, at the mouth, Freud’s surgeries, cigar: les pas de plus et les plus de pas [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: transference, ersatz, prosthesis, at the mouth, Freud’s surgeries, cigar: les pas de plus et les plus de pas [?]
